issue.title: bug: AI quiz, invalid checks - correct answer marked as invalid

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

issue.body: ### What is the URL where the issue is happening https://roadmap.sh/ai/quiz/javascript-fundamentals-quiz-1759565276780 ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Chrome ### Describe the Bug It appear that generated AI quiz miss the correct context and detect questions as incorrectly, when they're not incorrect. > Incorrect Answer > The typeof operator in JavaScript is used to determine the data type of a variable. It returns a string indicating the type of the operand. For example, typeof 42 returns "number", and typeof "hello" returns "string". that's not right ### Output from browser console (if any) _No response_ ### Participation - [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

issue.title: Lost Golang process after update

labels.name: topic-change
labels.description: Missing or deprecated topics in roadmap

issue.body:
### Roadmap URL

https://roadmap.sh/golang

### Suggestions

After Golang roadmap revamp I lost my process. After that I commented on an already opened issue instead of creating new one with comment 

> What about previous progress? I made a comment on the commit, but did not get a response? This issue and my question were asked 2 weeks ago.

https://github.com/kamranahmedse/developer-roadmap/commit/76a9a62afb291c29231a05d203d8ff5cf81494af#commitcomment-162151444

It's been four months and this issue still persists. Despite being told it would be fixed, it has not been. I cannot figure out what I did or not and lots of sources missing/removed/changed. 

Previous issue closed as complete. #8923

comment.body: Go roadmap was completely revamped so we had to get rid of the old progresses unfortunately.

issue.title: Make Roadmaps' DevOps Projects Instantly Hands-On with KodeKloud Free Labs
issue.body:
### Feature Description

**Problem I See...**

Learners want to practice end-to-end DevOps projects but struggle with local setup (OS differences, tooling versions, cloud costs). This slows progress and reduces completion rates.

I am specifically talking about Roadmap's DevOps Projects here : https://roadmap.sh/devops/projects 

**Goal**

Use KodeKloud's large Portfolio of Free Labs as the default execution environment for Roadmaps 'DevOps' Projects, so learners can:

- Run projects instantly (no heavy local setups).
- Practice with real tools (Docker, K8s, Terraform, Ansible, CI/CD, Linux, etc).
- Follow a consistent, tested workflow directly in the browser.

**Approach (V1)**

1. Map Projects → Labs

- For each roadmap project, link the exact KodeKloud lab(s) that cover the required tool/step.
- Provide a step-by-step “Use This Lab” path inside each project README.

2. One-Click Start

- Add a “Run in KodeKloud” button (link) in project READMEs.
- Include prerequisites, expected time, and outcomes.

3. Minimal Local Setup

- Keep a local path optional. Default path = KodeKloud labs.

4. Artifacts

- Learners export/commit artifacts (configs, manifests, pipelines) back to this repo via templates.

**Scope (Initial Project Set)**

- Project A: Containerize a Node/Go app → push to registry → deploy to K8s
   _Labs: Docker basics, Kubernetes basics, kubectl, deployments_

- Project B: CI/CD pipeline (build, test, scan, deploy)
   _Labs: Git, Jenkins/GitHub Actions basics, image scanning_

- Project C: Infra as Code on cloud sandbox
   Labs: Terraform basics, provisioning workflow

- Project D: Configuration management for a web stack
   Labs: Ansible basics, playbooks, handlers, roles

- Project E: Observability starter
   Labs: Linux basics, logs, basic monitoring concepts

We’ll expand mapping in follow-ups.

**Success Criteria / Metrics**

- 80%+ of steps runnable without local installs.
- 50%+ increase in project completion (self-reported or repo submissions).
- Time-to-first-successful-run < 10 minutes.
- ≥ 5 community PRs adding or improving lab mappings in first month.


This is just an initial idea — would love to hear everyone’s thoughts!

comment.body: Thanks for the idea! We're not planning to add third-party labs right now, so closing this one. Appreciate the detailed write-up though!

issue.title: chore: add functionality for changelog navigation hover and smooth scrolling
issue.body:
## Description

Improves changelog navigation and user experience by adding hover effects and smooth scrolling to the "Actively Maintained" section on the homepage.

## Changes Made

- Enhanced hover styles for changelog items in [ChangelogBanner.astro] to match the theme's hover pattern
- Added smooth scrolling behavior for changelog anchor links
- Implemented JavaScript to handle proper navigation both within and to the changelog page
- Added visual feedback with translate-x animation and color transitions on hover

### Before

![chrome-capture-2025-09-18bb](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d41ef8a3-0299-41a3-9bcb-c3d0838d6e97)

### After
![chrome-capture-2025-09-18af](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2ddfe12e-05eb-4ca2-8176-9b3d4e2e9c45)

## Problem Solved

Before the update, the changelog items in the "Actively Maintained" section lacked visual feedback on hover and didn't provide smooth navigation to specific changelog entries.

## Testing

- [x] Tested hover effects on changelog items in "Actively Maintained" section
- [x] Verified smooth scrolling navigation to specific changelog entries
- [x] Confirmed navigation works both from homepage to changelog and within changelog page

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality not to work as expected)

comment.body: No need for all the JavaScript, just having the hover effect with CSS should be enough.
